title: SB 1.17.38 part 1 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 17-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Gyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chaksharun Militam Yena Tasvain Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 38th verse of the 17th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Sūta uvāca abhyartitas tadātasmai sthānāni kalaye dadau
tyūtaṁ pānam sthriya-sūnā yatra adharmas chatur vidhahā
Sūta Goswami said, Mahārāja Parikṣit, thus being petitioned by the personality of Kali,
gave him permission to reside in places where gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed.
This is a very, very, very important verse in the entire Bhagavatam, I would say,
because this describes the four places where Kali was given permission to reside by Parikṣit Mahārāja,
where life was spared.
And who is Kali?
Kali is the one who spreads irreligion.
He spreads evil influence.
He influences people in an evil way to commit sinful activities even though they may not be sinful otherwise.
So what are those four places?
Parikṣit Mahārāja gave permission to Kali to reside in a place where there is gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed.
Parikṣit Mahārāja gave permission to Kali to reside in a place where there is gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed.
So what are those four places where there is gambling going on?
